headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Apple, Oracle, Klarna, Synopsys
summary: ↗️ Oracle (ORCL): The software company forecast huge gains in cloud-infrastructure revenue, giving investors reason to overlook quarterly results that missed expectations. Shares surged 36% and fueled a rally in AI-related stocks, including Broadcom (AVGO), Nvidia (NVDA) and TSMC (TSM).

headline: Oracle Stock Finishes 36% Higher in Historic Rally
summary: Shares in Oracle soared Wednesday after a blowout quarter in which the tech company won hundreds of billions of dollars of future artificial-intelligence-related business.  Oracle's rally was the first time a U.S. company with a market cap of $500 billion or more gained more than 25% in a single trading day.  The runup offers a big boost to the wealth of Chairman Larry Ellison, already ranked the world's second-richest person by Forbes.

headline: Chip Stocks Are on the Move. Where Do AMD and Micron Go Next?
summary: Broadcom  surged 9% on Sept. 5 after earnings, though the stock did retreat a bit off intraday highs.  Wednesday the stock rose 8% in afternoon trading, likely a direct result of  Oracle  earnings, giving a boost to the overall group.  Indeed, the ETF is up 1.5% in Wednesday trading to around $253 to flirt with a fresh all-time high.

headline: Nvidia Soars Past Key Level After Oracle's AI Cloud Backlog Spikes; Is Nvidia Stock A Buy Or Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia  jumped past a key level on Wednesday, aided by a robust outlook for artificial intelligence revenue from Oracle .  In late August, Nvidia posted second-quarter financial results that topped Wall Street's expectations, but it forecast just a slightly higher current-quarter revenue outlook.  Is Nvidia stock a buy or sell now?

headline: Oracle boosts chip stocks, NIO plunges, Netflix & Amazon team up

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
